meanings.definition: To introduce (a new or different element) into something
meanings.sent1: She enjoys injecting creativity into her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to inject some extra flavor into the dish.
meanings.sent3: The magician was known for injecting humor into his tricks.
meanings.sent4: The new employee injected fresh ideas into the project.
meanings.sent5: The teacher injected enthusiasm into the classroom with her engaging lessons.

meanings.definition: To administer (a drug or other substance) into the body using a needle or syringe
meanings.sent1: The nurse is skilled at injecting medicine into patients.
meanings.sent2: He needed to inject insulin to manage his diabetes.
meanings.sent3: The doctor joked about injecting a dose of laughter for good health.
meanings.sent4: The athlete felt like injecting energy into his tired muscles.
meanings.sent5: The veterinarian carefully injected the vaccine to protect the pet from diseases.
